title: (x) Ornament and sans on personal website - ITC Edwardian, Century Gothic {Mike Y}
content:
The first one is probably impossible to figure out - it’s an E rotated forward 90 degrees and blown up as a “decoration” on my website, but I have changed the design now. My AD and I had sort of a falling out over the site and he has not shared the information about what font this is. I think the other one - CONTACT - is Century Gothic but I might be wrong.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411063001im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/BFB%20714_6438.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411063001im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/font_6288.gif)

 [‹ (x) Frank Zappa/Grandmaster Flash record covers - custom designed/Quicksilver {Dav/Tim D}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411063001/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20222 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) The Film Consortium logo grotesque - Akzidenz-Grotesk {Manlio, Sebastian} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411063001/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33898 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Charlotta

comments.content:
The E is the Alternate form from [ITC Edwardian Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411063001/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-edwardian-script/). (edit: Probably the bold weight)

- Mike Yanega

The CONTACT lettering does look like [Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080411063001/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/century-gothic/), which is kind of like a flattened Futura.

- Mike Yanega

Good spot on that script Mike.

Tim
Thank you, Mike, that’s impressive. I didn’t think it would be possible to see what font it is.
